x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Nonprofits often struggle to identify which donors are most likely to contribute or who is at risk of discontinuing their support. Many organizations rely on manual processes or simple CRM systems, which don’t provide predictive analytics for donor engagement and retention.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The system would use machine learning algorithms to analyze historical donation data and predict donor behavior. It could generate insights into when a donor is likely to give again, how much they might donate, and even what type of messaging or campaign would resonate with them. ServiceNow’s Predictive Analytics and Performance Analytics could be used to create the predictive models and dashboards.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with third-party CRM and payment processing systems (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) for donation tracking. Also, a robust data pipeline to clean and process historical donation data for accurate predictions.
  • Performance Analytics
  • Predictive Analytics
  • Reporting & Dashboard

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

The quality and cleanliness of historical data would significantly impact the model’s accuracy. Convincing nonprofits to adopt predictive analytics and making the insights actionable in their daily workflows could also be a barrier.
